subject: Re: [junit] Database testing puzzle
msgSnippet: ... I might be missing something, but what I would do is switch the database that is being used during the tests, then run them and make sure that all the
messageBody:
On Thu, 2004-04-15 at 11:14, Dave Bender wrote:
> [..] But I'm puzzled, then, about how to do testing to verify that the
> results from the database interactions are identical since I have to
> stop and start the application to switch databases.

I might be missing something, but what I would do is switch the database
that is being used during the tests, then run them and make sure that
all the tests pass.

That is to say, I'm not so much interested in whether the results from
the database interactions are identical; I'm mostly interested in making
sure that the results of using the app with Database A are correct,
andthat the results of using the app with Database B are correct as
well. That would sort of imply that the databases behave the same way,
but I'm not sure why that would be my direct concern.

Does that make sense? Would that work in your situation?

Cheers,

bn
